title: Two Sri Lanka Monetary Board members to continue
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Two members of the rate setting monetary board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka have agreed to continue in office, newly appointed Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.
Ranee Jayamaha, a former central bank Deputy Govenor and Sanjeeva Jayawardena, a President’s Counsel, both appointed members, would continue.

“As I have the fullest faith and confidence in their complete professionalism, I look forward to receiving their continuing contribution and valuable guidance to the Nation, the Monetary Board and to me, as the Governor,” Governor Weerasinghe said in a statement.
Earlier, Samantha Kumarasinghe, a businessman who was lobbying for protectionism, resigned.
